item.title: M1 Utility, Risk and Insurance
item.description: Introduction # Decision making under risk and uncertainty # Context # In an Enterprise Risk Management context (ERM), “risk” is defined as the “effect of uncertainty on objectives” So essential ingredients here are: having an objective (e.g. maximise profit under some solvency constraint) having to make a decision (e.g. decide on how much to (re)insure) the object is subject to uncertainty (e.g. the amount of losses an insurer will have to pay) Understand decisions # In economics (and social science in general), one can be interested in understanding / modelling how and why individuals make decisions.
